commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Morning.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Morning. The day of the info session is finally here!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: I was so nervous I didn't get much sleep last night.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Same here. I'm still a little sleepy.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Looks like I'll be the perkiest one for once.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Really now... We've done what we could, so let's see it through!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Yeah, for sure! All that's left now is to put all our support behind Setsu.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I guess it's kind of late to say this, but are you sure you want me to give the presentation?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Of course. I asked you because I thought you were the right person to do it.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: You used to be student council president, so you're used to giving speeches in front of people.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: We can definitely count on you to do a good job!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So let me ask again, will you do it?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Yes, I will. I'll do my very best to live up to your expectations.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Don't worry. If anything happens, I'll take over for you! You can rest easy!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: You'll take over, Kasukasu?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Don't call me Kasukasu! Please!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: No way, it's so cute!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Yes, I'm very cute, but you're not allowed to call me Kasukasu!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: That reminds me, the girls from μ's and Aqours sent messages saying that they were counting on us to get all the volunteers excited during the info session.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I want to say again that it really is so reassuring to have 1,000 people showing up to help us with the School Idol Festival.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: We're going to make a lot of new friends who'll work hard right alongside us.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Hey, what do you think about inviting everyone to the cafeteria for a little party after the info session?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Could 1,000 people even fit? But I bet if we add some chairs and squeeze in, it might work!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Guys, should we head over to the auditorium?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Ooh, I wonder if people are here yet. I'm so excited!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Wait... What?

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: There are so many empty seats...

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I don't know if we even have 100 people here, let alone 1,000...

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Umm, well, maybe it's still early?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: No... This is the start time.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Then... Oh, I know, maybe we told the volunteers the wrong start time?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: But there are already people here, so I don't think that was what happened...

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Maybe the trains are stopped or they hit traffic?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I just checked. There's no train delays or traffic, apparently...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Well, then why didn't everyone show up? I bet something must have happened. Can someone check their messages?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Good morning, everyone.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Shioriko...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I truly regret to inform you that these are all of the attendees for today's info session.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: That can't be! More must be on their way!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yeah! A thousand people signed up to say they'd volunteer!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: They're just late. This can't be everyone!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Oh... Guys, look at this!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: What's the matter?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I checked my messages, and I have tons saying they can't make it to the info session but that they wish us all the best.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: But they said they'd help us... I don't get it.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: This can't be...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I had hoped I was worrying for nothing, but this is just how things are.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: What do you mean, how things are?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: This happens a lot with volunteering. People are excited when they sign up, but the overwhelming majority will end up deciding it won't be worth it or it's too much trouble.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: No...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I believe that they do truly want to support you, but they lose heart when it involves any sort of real effort on their part.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: They want someone else to do it and they believe someone else definitely will, so it's all right if just one person bows out... That's the way they all think.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I do wish that feelings and passion were enough to get people on board. But you must accept the reality of the situation.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That said, look at how many people responded to your passion and showed up. From my point of view, it's a shock that even this many people are still here.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You have to live up to their expectations. No matter how few people turned out, you must hold a perfectly executed information session.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Also, I can wait until a later date for you to collect enough volunteers. However, I do advise you to bear in mind that you may have to give up.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Of course we'll hold the info session. And we'll gather up enough volunteers again.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: No matter what you say, Shioriko, I'm definitely not giving up. It's our dream to hold the School Idol Festival, after all!
